title: Harris Vs Trump: Campaign For Georgia Intensifies Ahead Of US Polls
content: US Vice President Kamala Harris campaigned across southern Georgia by bus Wednesday as Democrats try to harness a surge of enthusiasm and put the swing state back in play in November's election against Donald Trump.
summary: US Vice President Kamala Harris campaigned across southern Georgia by bus Wednesday as Democrats try to harness a surge of enthusiasm and put the swing state back in play in November's election against Donald Trump.

title: Why Is 'World's Most Important Stock' Nvidia Falling, Expert Explains
content: Artificial intelligence behemoth Nvidia on Wednesday said quarterly sales reached a higher-than-expected $30 billion in the last quarter, though that growth was slower than the furious pace seen in previous quarters.
summary: Artificial intelligence behemoth Nvidia on Wednesday said quarterly sales reached a higher-than-expected $30 billion in the last quarter, though that growth was slower than the furious pace seen in previous quarters.

title: Condom Use Among European Teens "Worryingly" Declining: WHO
content: Condom use among sexually active teens has declined significantly in Europe over the past decade, with rates of unprotected sex "worryingly high", the World Health Organization said Thursday.
summary: Condom use among sexually active teens has declined significantly in Europe over the past decade, with rates of unprotected sex "worryingly high", the World Health Organization said Thursday.

title: Brazil Threatens To Suspend Elon Musk's X In Country Within 24 Hours
content: Brazilian Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes ordered Elon Musk on Wednesday to name a legal representative for his messaging platform X in Brazil within 24 hours or face the site's suspension in the country, a court decision showed.
summary: Brazilian Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes ordered Elon Musk on Wednesday to name a legal representative for his messaging platform X in Brazil within 24 hours or face the site's suspension in the country, a court decision showed.

title: FBI Reveals Gunman Viewed Trump Rally As "Target Of Opportunity": Report
content: The FBI on Wednesday revealed that the gunman who attempted to kill former President Donald Trump at a Pennsylvania campaign rally last month viewed the event as a "target of opportunity," Al-Jazeera reported.
summary: The FBI on Wednesday revealed that the gunman who attempted to kill former President Donald Trump at a Pennsylvania campaign rally last month viewed the event as a "target of opportunity," Al-Jazeera reported.

title: Pavel Durov: Mysterious And Controversial Telegram Founder
content: Russian-born tech entrepreneur Pavel Durov has founded wildly popular social networks, cryptocurrencies, amassed a multi-billion-dollar fortune and locked horns with authorities, in Russia and around the world.
summary: Russian-born tech entrepreneur Pavel Durov has founded wildly popular social networks, cryptocurrencies, amassed a multi-billion-dollar fortune and locked horns with authorities, in Russia and around the world.

title: Typhoon Makes Landfall On Japanese Island Of Kyushu: Weather Office
content: A major typhoon made landfall on Japan's main southern island of Kyushu on Thursday morning, the weather office said.
summary: A major typhoon made landfall on Japan's main southern island of Kyushu on Thursday morning, the weather office said.

title: Iran Appoints 1st Female Government Spokesperson
content: In another first, a woman will be the public face of the new Iranian government with Fatemeh Mohajerani being appointed the government spokesperson of Masoud Pezeshkian regime.
summary: In another first, a woman will be the public face of the new Iranian government with Fatemeh Mohajerani being appointed the government spokesperson of Masoud Pezeshkian regime.

title: United Nations Vehicle In Gaza Hit By Israeli Gunfire
content: The United Nations has reported that one of its humanitarian vehicles in Gaza, marked with the organisation's insignia, was fired upon 10 times by Israeli forces, including shots targeting its front windows.
summary: The United Nations has reported that one of its humanitarian vehicles in Gaza, marked with the organisation's insignia, was fired upon 10 times by Israeli forces, including shots targeting its front windows.

title: Telegram Chief Pavel Durov Charged, Banned From Leaving France
content: The chief of Telegram Pavel Durov on Wednesday was charged by the French judiciary with a litany of violations related to the messaging app but allowed to go free while being banned from leaving the country.
summary: The chief of Telegram Pavel Durov on Wednesday was charged by the French judiciary with a litany of violations related to the messaging app but allowed to go free while being banned from leaving the country.

title: Gunman Spent Months Seeking A Target, Then Settled On Donald Trump: FBI
content: The gunman who tried to kill Donald Trump mounted a "sustained, detailed effort" to attack a major gathering of some sort before deciding to target the Republican presidential candidate at a Pennsylvania rally in July, FBI officials said.
summary: The gunman who tried to kill Donald Trump mounted a "sustained, detailed effort" to attack a major gathering of some sort before deciding to target the Republican presidential candidate at a Pennsylvania rally in July, FBI officials said.

title: Israel Says Failed To Stop West Bank Attack That Killed 1 Palestinian
content: The Israeli military said on Wednesday it had "failed" in its response to a settler attack in the occupied West Bank earlier this month that Palestinian officials said killed one man.
summary: The Israeli military said on Wednesday it had "failed" in its response to a settler attack in the occupied West Bank earlier this month that Palestinian officials said killed one man.

title: Israel PM Sees US Sanctions On West Bank Settlers With "Utmost Severity"
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Wednesday he views "with utmost severity" new sanctions imposed by Washington on Israeli setters in the West Bank over violence against Palestinians.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Wednesday he views "with utmost severity" new sanctions imposed by Washington on Israeli setters in the West Bank over violence against Palestinians.

title: In Pics: Spain's Iconic Tomatina Festival In Full Glory
content: The streets of a town in eastern Spain were awash in red on Wednesday as revellers flung overripe tomatoes at each other in a high-spirited battle royale during the traditional Tomatina festival.
summary: The streets of a town in eastern Spain were awash in red on Wednesday as revellers flung overripe tomatoes at each other in a high-spirited battle royale during the traditional Tomatina festival.

title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Tops $1 Trillion In Market Value
content: Berkshire Hathaway Inc. became the first US company outside of the tech sector to surpass $1 trillion in market value.
summary: Berkshire Hathaway Inc. became the first US company outside of the tech sector to surpass $1 trillion in market value.

title: Israel Launches Deadly West Bank Operation As Gaza War Drags On
content: Israel launched a large-scale military operation today in the West Bank, where the army said it killed nine Palestinian fighters, while the nearly 11-month Gaza war showed no signs of abating.
summary: Israel launched a large-scale military operation today in the West Bank, where the army said it killed nine Palestinian fighters, while the nearly 11-month Gaza war showed no signs of abating.

title: 92 US Citizens Banned From Entering Russia: Report
content: Russia said Wednesday it had banned another 92 US citizens from entering its territory, listing names of reporters from the Wall Street Journal, New York Times and Washington Post.
summary: Russia said Wednesday it had banned another 92 US citizens from entering its territory, listing names of reporters from the Wall Street Journal, New York Times and Washington Post.

title: Historic Mission Featuring First-Ever Private Spacewalk Postponed By SpaceX
content: SpaceX postponed once more its attempt at launching a daring orbital expedition featuring an all-civilian crew that is aiming to carry out the first-ever spacewalk by private citizens.
summary: SpaceX postponed once more its attempt at launching a daring orbital expedition featuring an all-civilian crew that is aiming to carry out the first-ever spacewalk by private citizens.

title: Boy Shatters 3,500-Year-Old Bronze Age Jar At Israel Museum
content: A four year old boy accidentally shattered a rare bronze age jar that was on display at an archaeological museum in Haifa, Israel.
summary: A four year old boy accidentally shattered a rare bronze age jar that was on display at an archaeological museum in Haifa, Israel.

title: Telegram CEO Pavel Durov To Appear In Paris Court: Report
content: Telegram founder and chief Pavel Durov was headed to court in Paris Wednesday where he could be formally charged, after his initial arrest period for questioning came to an end, a source familiar with the case told AFP.
summary: Telegram founder and chief Pavel Durov was headed to court in Paris Wednesday where he could be formally charged, after his initial arrest period for questioning came to an end, a source familiar with the case told AFP.
